DOC.detailed_description: Helicobacter pylorus ( HP ) , bacterium present many people 's stomach , one major cause ulcer cancer . Up 20 % patient infected HP may develop peptic ulcer . However , failure rate rise due multiple resistant HP infection . The eradication rate first line clarithromycin base therapy fell 80 % increase number patient also fail second line quadruple therapy . The aim clinical trial compare efficacy tolerability H. pylori eradication 10-day quadruple therapy versus sequential therapy empirical first second line treatment . Methods : Eligible H. pylorus positive patient randomize receive either QUAD ( esomeprazole 20mg twice daily , bismuth subcitrate 120mg four time daily , tetracycline 500mg four time daily metronidazole 400mg four time daily ) 10 day SEQ ( esomeprazole 20mg twice daily 10 day , amoxicillin 1g twice daily first 5 day , clarithromycin 500mg twice daily metronidazole 400mg four time daily subsequent 5 day ) . All patient return 8 week complete treatment Urea Breath Test ( UBT ) confirm eradication . Patients fail respective therapy crossover receive alternative regimen .
